messages.title: Fighting for a fairer future
messages.content: Andy Botham is the Labour Party Parliamentary Candidate for Derbyshire Dales. Andy is hardworking and is campaigning for more jobs that pay a decent wage for the people of Derbyshire Dales.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop the privatisation of the NHS and hire 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs.
Increase the minimum wage to more than £8 an hour by 2019. Ban exploitative zero-hour contracts.
Freeze gas and electricity bills until 2017 and reform the energy market.
Guarantee small class sizes for 5, 6 and 7 year olds, and a qualified teacher in every class.

issues.economy: Andy Botham will fight for sustainable jobs that pay a decent wage.
issues.education: Guarantee small class sizes for 5, 6 and 7 year olds, and a qualified teacher in every class.
issues.health: Stop the privatisation of the NHS and hire 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs.

leaflet.personalStatement: Andy has lived in Matlock for over 20 years with his wife and two children.

politicalExperience.achievements: Fighting against the cuts to our bus services and working to save our libraries.

images.caption: Andy at a local farm supporting local farmers.
